page.lettertext:
fol.83r
Belgia 1591 sti
l
R
15 Fe
b
To my L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
good L. forasmuch as
S
r
John Norris
is gon into
England,
wh
r
of I was advertised but 3
daies ago, wheras hee promised to remain at
Midelboro
or
Flushing
for 8 or 10 daies: I am th
r
fore to beseech
her
Ma
ty
to vouchsafe to send mee some direction.
For my furder
ceeding w
th
the
States
of these Countryes.
For Assuredly the people do murmur more & more
& they are earnestly bent to stoppe the passage of
their Comp
ies
w
ch
they will not onely endevour, if
the souldiers marche in troupes: but they have taken
such order as they can not come single. And though
S
r
John Norreis hath charged the Capt
nes
to casse
the Comp
ies
, & hath required the
Treasurers deputy
to surcease his paiement after the 20
th
of this moneth
supposing by that meanes that the townes must be
forced to
mitt them to de
te; yet undoutedly the
Countrey is so sharp sett against it, as they will minister
for a time sufficient vittaile to the souldiers, till they
see there is no remedy but her Hig
nes
will
sist
in her purpose intended. In this troublesome case
the Captaines are so doutfull what course they
should follow; that they write their l
re
s every
daie to know my advise. And for mine owne
te
consydering the importance of
e matter,
e discontentm
t
of this people, & the great inconvenience of
cassing the Comp
ies
, w
ch
most men hold opinion
willl scatter awaie by multitudes: considering also
that S
r
John Norris hath bin in England this sevennight
that her Hig
nes
both by him & oth
r
wise is effectually
enformed of the state of these affaires, & that the
winde hath bin good to bring us letters from home;
I have advised every Captaine, that hath written
unto mee, to staie the cassing of theyr bandes
till her Ma
t
further pleasure shalbee notified
fol.83v
unto them. The time I trust wilbee but short
and a littel attendance wilbee nothing prejudiciall
to
e effecting of her purpose. Rather I am
swaded, whensoever her Hig
nes
shall resolve to
drawe her subject
awaie in such manner as is
begunn, this protracting of the time will serve in
some sort to qualefie these mens choller, & make
the Action more easy then it would bee otherwise.
For I do assure yo
r
L. this dealing already of
her Ma
ty
hath so much humbled & amazed both the
Count & the rest, that were woont to bee so
opposit to all her
ceeding
, as I dout
not
for
heerafter but they will shew them selves more
conformable. The motion made by the
Councell
of State
to the Provinces for the new levie of
3000 horse & for the renforcing of theyr horseband
to 120 in every band is generally accorded for 7
monethes, & order shalbee given to
forme it p
nt
ly.
It is written from
Collen,
& also otherwise confirmed
that
e Bishop of
Liege,
&
e
Duke of Cleave
have raysed sondry troupes of horse & foote, w
th
full intention to chase awaie the Spaniard from out
of theyr territories. The death of
La Motte
is
advertised hether from sondry places:
And so I
rest in expectation of yo
r
L. next unto mee & take
my humble leave. Hage Feb
r
15 1590
